title: Who gets a ticket when there's no one behind the wheel?
contentencoded: Nissan just announced it will offer self-driving cars by the year 2020. Google is also working hard on autonomous cars. Bryant Walker Smith, fellow at the Center for Internet and Society at Stanford Law School, discusses the new legal issues presented by having cars with no drivers.
contenttemplated:
[{"content":"

Nissan just announced it will offer self-driving cars by the year 2020. Google is also working hard on autonomous cars. Bryant Walker Smith, fellow at the Center for Internet and Society at Stanford Law School, discusses the new legal issues presented by having cars with no drivers.

description: Driverless cars are on the horizon. So are new legal challenges to deal with them.
teaser: Driverless cars are on the horizon. So are new legal challenges to deal with them.
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Wednesday, August 28, 2013
